formattedAddress: 25 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 25 W 40th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

editorialSummary.text: American eatery situated on a prime patch of park real estate behind the New York Public Library.

originalText.text: We are at the Bryant Park Grill and enjoyed the fact that it was located on the edge of the park. The views were lovely. The food was very good and their menu is sizable and diverse. Our table server was very friendly and attentive. The only negatives we found was the receptionist was not very personable, not rude, just not friendly. The other issue was a dirty spot on the curtains adjacent to our seating. Not a big issue just out of line with the rest of the decor. Overall a pleasant experience.

text.text: We are at the Bryant Park Grill and enjoyed the fact that it was located on the edge of the park. The views were lovely. The food was very good and their menu is sizable and diverse. Our table server was very friendly and attentive. The only negatives we found was the receptionist was not very personable, not rude, just not friendly. The other issue was a dirty spot on the curtains adjacent to our seating. Not a big issue just out of line with the rest of the decor. Overall a pleasant experience.

originalText.text:
I had lunch during the month of December with my family, we were 7 people. Reservation is a must.

The service is excellent, all the staff is very friendly and profesional.
The quality of food, very specific the meat is excellent. I will repeat it again.

The restaurant is big with Parisian-style, big windows with a lot of natural light. It’s loud in case you are looking for something more quiet. This place is great for family parties and friends.

After or before eating, I recommend to have a walk around which is nice.

Highly recommended.

originalText.text: Great feeling overlooking Bryant Park, service staff impeccable and attentive, even at the door during Christmas crowds. Food all good as expected, despite the full house crowds. Only hit is the high price for this place. Parking also an issue as it's directly sandwiched behind the library and the park, so will need to find parking in nearby parking garages.

text.text: Great feeling overlooking Bryant Park, service staff impeccable and attentive, even at the door during Christmas crowds. Food all good as expected, despite the full house crowds. Only hit is the high price for this place. Parking also an issue as it's directly sandwiched behind the library and the park, so will need to find parking in nearby parking garages.

originalText.text: Bryant Park Grill was the PERFECT place to host our wedding reception. From admin to the waiters at the reception, the staff is the most professional, buttoned-up, classic New York group who executed everything to perfection on our wedding day. Linda was so fun to do business with and throughout the entire process, she was incredibly confident in BPG's abilities and experienced with hundreds of weddings. On the day of, Diane was our captain and she anticipated every single one of our wants or needs throughout the evening. If you also have your ceremony here, you truly will not need a wedding coordinator. PLUS I was shocked at how reasonable the package pricing was compared to other iconic NYC venues. Bonus points for having the NY Public Library next door for truly breathtaking photos. 100 out of 10!

originalText.text:
Such an aesthetically pleasing restaurant. Loved that the trees were not cut down to build the other side of the restaurant. Trees were incorporated into the incorporate to the Decour of the restaurant.

Now to the food, we love calamari, and their calamari  was so good. My husband got a burger, and I got the filet mignon and my son got the chicken tenders with fries. He didn’t like the chicken tenders so he ended up getting my filet mignon. Drinks and food are amazing. Service was great.

We did come with our child, and there is no kids menu. But they do offer a pasta for the children or the chicken tenders with fries.  Portions are very generous, so I could’ve skipped, ordering the chicken tenders for him and just shared my filet mignon.
